title: Unit 8 Checkpoint: Applications of Integration
description: Unit test + cumulative integration FRQ set. Covers average value, motion via integrals, net change, area between curves, and volume by cross-sections and disk/washer.

remediationStrategy.description: Students scoring below threshold receive focused reteaching before final review.

clusters.reteachFocus: Displacement vs total distance, net change theorem
Top minus bottom, finding intersections, choosing dx vs dy
Disk: π∫R²dx, washer: π∫(R²-r²)dx, revolving around non-axis lines

assessmentProblems.question: Find the average value of f(x) = x² + 1 on [0, 3].
A particle moves with velocity v(t) = t² - 4t + 3 = (t-1)(t-3) for 0 ≤ t ≤ 5. Find: (a) displacement, (b) total distance traveled.
Find the area enclosed by y = x² and y = 2x + 3.
The base of a solid is the region bounded by y = √x and y = 0 from x=0 to x=4. Cross-sections perpendicular to the x-axis are squares. Find the volume.
assessmentProblems.answer: Side of square = √x. A(x) = (√x)² = x. V = ∫₀⁴ x dx = [x²/2]₀⁴ = 8.

assessmentProblems.question: Find the volume when the region between y = √x and y = 0, from x=0 to x=4, is revolved about the x-axis.
assessmentProblems.answer: Disk method: V = π∫₀⁴(√x)²dx = π∫₀⁴ x dx = π[x²/2]₀⁴ = 8π.

assessmentProblems.question: Find the volume when the region between y = x² and y = x is revolved about the x-axis.
assessmentProblems.answer: Intersections: x² = x → x(x-1)=0 → x=0,1. y=x is outer (on top). Washer: V = π∫₀¹[(x)²-(x²)²]dx = π∫₀¹(x²-x⁴)dx = π[x³/3-x⁵/5]₀¹ = π(1/3-1/5) = 2π/15.

assessmentProblems.question: (FRQ) The rate of water flowing into a tank is r(t) = 200 - 4t² gallons/minute for 0 ≤ t ≤ 7. (a) Find the total amount of water that flows in from t=0 to t=5. (b) Find the average rate of flow on [0, 5]. (c) At what time is the rate of flow 100 gal/min?
SPIRAL: Find dy/dx if y = ∫₂ˣ sin(t²)dt, then evaluate dy/dx at x = √π.
assessmentProblems.answer: By FTC1: dy/dx = sin(x²). At x=√π: sin(π) = 0.
